parts.text:
```xml
<output>
<analysis>
<has-cmf>The post does not contain a CMF number.  While the absence of a CMF number doesn't automatically exclude it from being considered electoral propaganda, it suggests it might not be officially sanctioned campaign material.</has-cmf>
<refers-to-candidate>The post explicitly mentions the PNL (Partidul Național Liberal) party. This directly refers to a parliamentary candidate, fulfilling Article 36 (7) - a.</refers-to-candidate>
<addresses-the-wide-population>The post is a paid Facebook advertisement, inherently designed to reach a wide audience.  It's not a private message; therefore, it addresses the wide population, fulfilling Article 36 (7) - c.</addresses-the-wide-population>
<electoral-objective>The statement "Eu aleg să susțin echipa PNL și stabilitatea!" ("I choose to support the PNL team and stability!") clearly aims to influence voters to support the PNL. This demonstrates an electoral objective, fulfilling Article 36 (7) - c. The call to "Gândiți cu înțelepciune pentru viitorul nostru comun!" ("Think wisely about our common future!") further reinforces this objective by implicitly linking the PNL to a positive future.</electoral-objective>
<journalism>The post lacks the characteristics of journalistic reporting. It doesn't present objective facts, diverse perspectives, or verifiable evidence. Instead, it promotes a specific political party, lacking the neutrality expected from journalism.</journalism>
<personal_opinion>While the initial sentence encourages respect for differing opinions, the subsequent endorsement of the PNL transforms the post into something beyond a personal opinion. The overall message is clearly intended to sway voters towards the PNL.</personal_opinion>
</analysis>

<conclusion>
<post_id>581415000943629</post_id>
<electoral-propaganda-analysis>
The Facebook post, a paid advertisement by Rafael Nichita, promotes the PNL party.  It directly mentions the party, expresses support for it, and implicitly links it to a positive future.  The post's design and placement as a paid advertisement on a public platform clearly target a wide audience. While it begins with a seemingly neutral call for respect, the subsequent endorsement of the PNL outweighs this, making the overall message a clear attempt to influence voters.  The absence of a CMF number is noteworthy but doesn't negate the promotional nature of the post.  The post fulfills all criteria of Article 36 (7) of LEGE nr. 334 din 17 iulie 2006, defining it as electoral propaganda.
</electoral-propaganda-analysis>
<electoral-propaganda-decision>TRUE</electoral-propaganda-decision>
<electoral-propaganda-candidates>
  <candidate><name>PNL</name><impact>POSITIVE</impact></candidate>
</electoral-propaganda-candidates>
<responsible-party-or-group>PNL</responsible-party-or-group>
<message-for-police>
Rafael Nichita, pentru încălcarea articolului 98 t) din LEGEA nr. 208 din 20 iulie 2015, prin publicarea, după ora 18:00 pe 23.11.2024, a unei postări pe Facebook (ID 581415000943629) care constituie propagandă electorală pentru PNL, având ca efect electoral influențarea votului în favoarea acestui partid. Postarea, deși începe cu un apel la respect, promovează în mod explicit PNL prin afirmația „Eu aleg să susțin echipa PNL și stabilitatea!”,  având ca obiectiv influențarea electoratului.  Această postare, fiind o reclamă plătită pe o platformă publică, se adresează unui public larg și îndeplinește toate criteriile articolului 36 (7) din LEGE nr. 334 din 17 iulie 2006, fiind considerată propagandă electorală.
</message-for-police>
</conclusion>
</output>
```
